solution_line_template: Out of {total_students} students, half are girls and half are boys so there are {total_students}/{half_divisor} = <<{total_students}/{half_divisor}={num_girls}>>{num_girls} girls
There are {num_girls} girls out of {total_students} students means there are {total_students}-{num_girls} = <<{total_students}-{num_girls}={num_boys}>>{num_boys} boys
20% of the {num_girls} girls have dogs so they have {girls_dog_percent_decimal}*{num_girls} = <<{girls_dog_percent_num}*{percent_factor}*{num_girls}={girls_with_dogs}>>{girls_with_dogs} dogs
10% of the {num_boys} boys have dogs so they have {boys_dog_percent_decimal}*{num_boys} = <<{boys_dog_percent_decimal}*{num_boys}={boys_with_dogs}>>{boys_with_dogs} dogs

The girls have {girls_with_dogs} dogs and the boys have {boys_with_dogs} dogs so together, they have {girls_with_dogs}+{boys_with_dogs} = <<{girls_with_dogs}+{boys_with_dogs}={total_dogs}>>{total_dogs} dogs
